examples: The U.S. tax code now loads the dice in favor of private pension plans.
Going mountain-climbing alone is dicing with death.

I hadn't booked, so no dice.
words.defineEn: a small cube used in games of chance with six sides each having one to six spots representing numbers
words.defineVi: một khối lập phương nhỏ được sử dụng trong các trò chơi may rủi với sáu mặt, mỗi mặt có một đến sáu điểm đại diện cho các số

examples: Which tie do you like best?
She finally loosened her tie after a long day at work.

He wore a tie to the wedding for a unique look.
She tied some strips of cloth around the wound to check the bleeding.
words.defineEn: the result of a game in which players or teams have even scores
words.defineVi: kết quả của một trò chơi trong đó người chơi hoặc đội có số điểm chẵn

examples: Which tie do you like best?
She finally loosened her tie after a long day at work.
Do I have to wear a tie?

She tied some strips of cloth around the wound to check the bleeding.
words.defineEn: (of two players or teams) to finish a game or competition with even scores
words.defineVi: (của hai người chơi hoặc đội) để kết thúc một trò chơi hoặc cuộc thi với số điểm chẵn

examples: They're cheating you out of millions!

If he thinks he can cheat me, just let him try!
Susan saw a colleague take credit for another's work but still get passed over for promotion, confirming that cheaters never win and winners never cheat.
words.defineEn: to win or gain an advantage in a game, completion, etc. by violating rules or acting unfairly
words.defineVi: giành chiến thắng hoặc đạt được lợi thế trong một trò chơi, hoàn thành, v.v. bằng cách vi phạm các quy tắc hoặc hành động không công bằng

examples: The Siemens display goes the whole hog.

To go swimming/fishing/jogging.

words.defineEn: to use one's turn in a game
words.defineVi: sử dụng lượt của một người trong một trò chơi

examples: The sunflower turned its face towards the sun.

Turn the mould upside down.
words.defineEn: the time when someone has the opportunity, obligation, or right to do a certain thing that everyone does successively in a group
words.defineVi: thời gian khi ai đó có cơ hội, nghĩa vụ hoặc quyền làm một điều gì đó mà mọi người làm liên tiếp trong một nhóm

examples: The manager played his strongest side of the season.

words.defineEn: an activity that is done for fun, mostly by children
words.defineVi: một hoạt động được thực hiện cho vui, chủ yếu là bởi trẻ em

examples: I usually play chess with my brother.

She beats me at chess nine times out of ten.
When I play chess with my Dad I'm out of my league.
During the chess tournament, Jane was confident in her skills, but her opponent ended up cleaning her clock with a series of surprising moves.
words.defineEn: a strategic two-player board game where players move pieces with different abilities across a board with the objective of capturing the opponent's king
words.defineVi: một trò chơi cờ hai người chơi chiến lược trong đó người chơi di chuyển các quân cờ với các khả năng khác nhau trên một bàn cờ với mục tiêu chiếm được vua của đối phương

examples: Are you good at doing crosswords?

words.defineEn: a puzzle game in which one writes the answers to the clues in numbered boxes

words.defineEn: a small toy house often containing tiny furniture and small dolls as well

examples: The coach always keeps a few tricks up his sleeve.

He played a trick on his sister by putting a fake spider in her bed.
words.defineEn: an act performed to amuse people who might consider it magical
words.defineVi: một hành động được thực hiện để giải trí cho những người có thể coi đó là phép thuật

examples: She moved her queen.

examples: The house rules are crystal clear.

words.defineEn: an instruction that says what is or is not allowed in a given situation or while playing a game

examples: Bowling for animals is Animal Wonders annual fundraiser.

examples: There could be ping-pong.

words.defineEn: a thin and small rubber bag with a hole into which air is blown and is used as a toy or decoration

examples: The TV quiz was more fun than a barrel of monkeys!

and then we'll get a nice playtime

examples: Whew, that was a good game of hide-and-seek!

examples: And perhaps that same ingenuity will guide us out of this apparent checkmate.
